Crimes.Crime_Name: Material misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility and humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of officer's refusal of H&C application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant lacked credibility due to concealment of marital status
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior findings by IAD, lack of new evidence
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose material information at entry
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard for substantive decision; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – officer considered prior record but no new evidence submitted
Crimes.Application_Factor: Concealment of marital status affecting admissibility
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether decision was reasonable and procedurally fair
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of new evidence beyond IAD record
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review on grounds of unreasonableness

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose change in marital and parental status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of officer’s refusal under subsection 25(1) IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No new evidence provided beyond IAD record
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of inland visa exemption application
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate grounds for relief under s. 25(1)
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Officer has discretion under s. 25(1) IRPA to exempt from removal if justified on H&C grounds
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for decision; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Allegation of procedural unfairness or bias
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Application refused, no abuse of discretion
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Prior determination by IAD, absence of new evidence
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Judicial review of officer’s discretionary decision
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for factual issues; reasonableness for decision
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Decision upheld as reasonable and procedurally fair
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Record before IAD, lack of updated personal disclosure
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review setting aside officer’s decision
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Overturn of refusal and grant of visa exemption
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Inadmissible foreign national with prior exclusion order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Misrepresentation concerning marital and parental status
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IRPA s. 25(1) – Discretion to relieve from removal
